Description: Rim sherd of Attic red-figured pottery volute-krater; interior glazed black; top of rim reserved with black band at inner edge; exterior: on edge of rim, key maeander to left; on neck, red figure decoration consisting of top of basket and perhaps another; relief line throughout; incised inscription on top of rim.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), Site 39 (Hogarth), outside the south wall of the Hellenion (?)
Curator's comments: The finely chiselled letters are comparable to those on some Panathenaic amphoras dedicated at various sanctuaries. The sherd joins a fragment in Heidelberg and belongs to the same vase as Bonn 697.90 and possibly belongs to the same vase as Oxford AN1896-1908-G.138.36 and AN1896-1908-G.138.40. See Scholtz, A. 'Aphrodite Pandemos at Naukratis', Greek, Roman and Byzantine Studies 43, 2002-2003, 232. The sherd was excavated south of points 17 and 18 in the northern part of the Hellenion (Hogarth 1898/1899, 30, no. 107).
